item.content:encoded:
As mentioned in my previous post (starting off), this isn’t my first website. Nor, do I expect will it be the last. Now, I must disclaim that web development is not my strong suite, but I am extremely adaptive and resourceful.

My previous site was hosted on GitHub pages, so I was fairly familiar with what was involved, but I was using Jekyll to build the site from Markdown documents. The biggest challenge for me was getting the style right, and I couldn’t quite figure it out. This frustration let me to look for something different.

I have a background in WordPress, doing work for a non-profit organisation based out of Cape Town, South Africa. So I decided that it would be an easy enough way for me to start my endeavour. But I still wanted to host it on GitHub pages. I don’t know why I decided this, but I did.

So here we are, a WordPress site that has been statically generated and pushed to a GitHub repository.

item.content:encoded:
There is no better time than the present to get started with something you’ve been putting off. So here we are… I’ve completely redone my personal website.

I think it’s always a good thing to have a personal brand. What better way to present yourself in the modern day and age than with a personal website.

So here’s to the first post, the stepping stone into a new adventure.
